Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Dianespence
Reviews.Content: From picking us up at the airport to meeting the chef at dinner - our stay at this hotel could not have been better! This was my first time in Istanbul and I can't wait to come back and stay at this hotel - an amazing and helpful staff! Great breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable, clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: sue h
Reviews.Content: The staff could not have been kinder or more helpful. The Hotel is immaculately clean and in a great location. our standard room on the ground floor was small with no outlook (at the price we paid through an on-line retailer it was to be expected). However, as we were there for a few nights we upgraded at little expense to a lovely large room with 2 large windows with views of the ocean. Hotel is very quiet with no street noise and comfortable beds. One of our party was ill and the staff went out of their way to care for us. roof terrace was closed but staff encouraged us to go up there and have coffee. view amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ted G
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location within walking distance of all of the major sights. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room on the fourth floor was clean, comfortable and modern. The breakfast offered was exceptional. I would stay here again. My wife and I loved it. We booked another room for some friends and they too said it was one of the best hotels they've stayed in recently.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, efficient and very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: jill616161
Reviews.Content: A small room with no view, but at the price we paid it was to be expected. However, we were there very little so it didn't matter. It was quiet, there is little traffic in this street, and very comfortable with pleasant decor. The shower was great. The roof terrace was closed , but I did go up to sit once or twice to look at the view and in the summer I'm sure it will be lovely. The breakfasts were excellent with a wide variety of fresh food. The staff are very friendly and helpful from the desk personnel to the waiters and cleaners. I can thoroughly recommend this hotel and would be happy to return.Great location, of course, for museums and famous sights.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent service, yummy breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Lori H
Reviews.Content: We had a great trip to Istanbul that was only enhanced by our stay at Tria. The staff was eager to help us and very friendly. The hotel was clean and affordable and the daily breakfast offered a variety of tasty fresh fruit and veggies along with figs, apricots, walnuts, olives, yogurt and more. We recommend this hotel with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Lynn E.”
Reviews.Author: L E
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel, the room was a good size, clean and comfortable. The staff however makes it the best place to stay, they went the extra mile to be helpful. The location was great as we could get every where on foot. Many thanks to the staff at Tria

Reviews.Title: “Small comfortable hotel near restaurant zone”
Reviews.Author: DSH_Solihull
Reviews.Content: Good points: Friendly staff, comfortable and warm room (bear in mind it was snowing at the time..). Kettle and fridge. View of the Bosphorus, Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque (just about) from the roof (plus other people's roof installations of variable quality...). Interesting breakfasts, with a fair range of food (including some unusual heart-shaped Valentine's Day specials). We stayed enough days to qualify for a free transfer to the airport (both ways). Central location for Sultanahmet with lots of competing restaurants nearby. Downside: We had a "triple" in what was really a double room - a bit tight but not too bad. Some people thought the beds were hard. Next door's television (maybe they had it on a bit loud). Bit of a walk to Eminonu, and to the new city over the water.

Reviews.Title: “Very cosy hotel in the center of old city”
Reviews.Author: federico b
Reviews.Content: it was our second time in istanbul.This time we asked to organize our trip to Bonta Tour.They booked tria hotel for us. It was very nice and warm place. Friendly staff and very helpful.Rooms are clean and with sea view.l love breakfast in this hotel.it was a perfect holiday in Tria hotel and in IstamÃ§nbul. Thanks guys

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Sohiba
Reviews.Content: I have no words to express the fabulous hospitality i experienced at Tria Hotel. Its location is amazing and the price was also right for my pocket. Would love to return, infact I am so impressed that I am booking my next holiday in Tria .. I must compliment and thank the entire team specially - Mr. Erhan and Mr. Levent for taking such good care of the guests. Rooms are well kept, cosy and makes you feel at home. As a single lady, I felt so safe to be. The restaurant at Tria Elegance is awesome, food is to die for ! I can still feel the after taste in my mouth as i write this ! I miss TRIA so much, cant wait to be there again ... Strongly recommend anyone who is visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “200% coming back”
Reviews.Author: ban g
Reviews.Content: the hotel is at a great location.........the ambiance and the guest service is something i felt in love with................there was a guy at the front desk named "ERHAN" very professional, courteous i was new to turkey an especially Istanbul he guided me to some of the best place in the town....................if i am ever coming back it would be just because of "ERHAN".............thanks you again

Reviews.Title: “Tria, a Find!”
Reviews.Author: Roxaneb1
Reviews.Content: I heartily recommend Tria Hotel and Restaurant to visitors who want to be within walking distance of the major sites in Istanbulâ€™s Old Town. This small hotel is situated on a quiet street yet just around the corner from the buzz of numerous restaurants. Our room, with a limited view of the Bosphorus, was spacious, clean, and quiet. Every morning we enjoyed a delicious breakfast from their plentiful buffet and also enjoyed two good dinners at their restaurant. The hotel staff, well-informed and helpful, gave outstanding service. Staying at the Tria added to our enjoyment of wonderful Istanbul, and if we visit again, I would definitely book at the Tria. It gave us a sense of place and neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: TRodriquez
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for a week during our trip to Istanbul. The hotel is on a tiny side street so there is not much traffic. There was a small store across the road that was very convenient. The room we had did not have a great view but it was very clean and the bedding felt like we were at a fancy hotel. It was great. We ate breakfast in the dining room daily and there were enough choices to satisfy. The room was better priced than others in the area. The staff at the hotel was the best part. Everyone went above and beyond to help us find things to do and arrange transportation, especially Erhan. I will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Tria Would stay again when Come Istanbul again”
Reviews.Author: oprina55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed for 5 nights in this hotel as part of a city break in Istanbul. The location of the hotel is excellent being within a short walking distance of many of the main attractions, the Arasta Bazaar, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosgue, Grandbazzar etc. The hotel has been upgraded recently and the rooms were clean and spacious, the en-suite bathroom was very good and everything worked. I contacted the Tria directly and that began a very positive experience. Kucukaras Arhan answered Many questions I had and sent me the most detailed information I have ever received from any tourist group - giving me information about Ottoman places to see and exactly how long it would take to walk from the hotel to the sites We were on the bed & breakfast tariff and the breakfast in the hotel is excellent with a very wide selection of hot and cold options. We ate twice in the hotel restaurant, Tria Elegance Ottoman restaurant, which serves a varied range of Ottoman cuisine. Although we ate at two other restaurants on Akbiyik caddesi, this was the best and also very good value. Anyway , we cannot speak highly enough of my experience Hotel Tria and will most definitely return back to Tria on my Next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Margaret S
Reviews.Content: The Tria Hotel is a charming and friendly atmosphere in the heart of Istanbul's Old Town. We were picked up at the airport, and the service continued with wonderful recommendations for walking tours and restaurants. Our rooms were elegant and comfortable with beautiful views, and the breakfast buffet was delicious!! Thank-you again Erhan and Mustafa for such a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: anastasia b
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed Tria . funny staff, excellent service and in the middle of all of the oldcity. Absolutely recommend Tria hotel and will come back on next trip. tesekkur edeim Erhan Kucukaras

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: rakhi_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tria Special class It was great value for money Being a couple , the room was perfect for someone like us who just wanted to use it to wind down in the evenings Generous buffet breakfast spread, amazing staff who go out of their way to make you comfortable Its got a fantastic location - we didnt walk more than 8-10 minutes to all major sights including Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque,etc The tram station too is very close by Definitely recommending it my friends too!!

Reviews.Title: “3 days in a perfect place”
Reviews.Author: SvetlankaD
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 days. The Tria is incredibly cozy hotel. Well-equipped and comfortable rooms, peaceful and convenient roof terrace with the most wonderful view. Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, and of course the Bosphorus...all sights just a few steps away. The staff was very friendly. Hope I'll have a chance to come back here next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: jesska_j
Reviews.Content: Staying in this great hotel made our holiday! We were in the best location and were within walking distance to everything! Great views of the ocean and the rooftop terrace was the perfect end to each day! The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff very helpful with any assistance we required!

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff lovely hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: kinco m
Reviews.Content: We booked a standart room in Tria Hotel for our three days stay in Sultanahmethotel is in the perfect location for spending a few days exploring Oldcity. Upon our arrival we were upgraded to the Deluxe Suit. We love Deluxe room, it was decorated in style, plus it was clean, spacious and comfortable. The staff were very nice and helpful . Special thank you too Kucukaras Arhan for help,patience and understanding. Great!! The hotel was in the herth of Old city Sultanahmet, and the Sultanahmet tram station was a 5min walk from the hotel, only one station away from Grand Bazaar..I appreciated their hospitality, sightseeing advice, and friendliness. We would definitely stay Tria hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Niki C
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends (7 in total) stayed in Tria Hotel during November. I have visited Istanbul twice and I have stayed at Tria Hotel both times and sure enough I will stay there again. Most important important sites are within walking area and the tram is very close as well, which is very convenient if you are planning a short stay. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. The staff is very helpful and friendly and were willing to help us with anything that made our stay easier and pleasant. We had already booked the transfer from the airport which made it really easy for us to arrive to the hotel. I look forward to going back soon!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel i would recommend to all my friends”
Reviews.Author: chanokporn s
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the tria hotel. The staff were very professional and incredibly helpful. especially Eran at the front desk was very helpfull, he ensured that all my arrangements and requests were met and all in all were very accomodating. Hotel and restaurant is first class and my room was very comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who plan to go to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Istanbul tourist area”
Reviews.Author: Perthjerryatric
Reviews.Content: Was able to negotiate a good rate in the quieter time of year and enjoyed 4 nights there. Good clean hotel, very helpful and friendly staff, breakfast included, great hot shower and brilliantly located within minutes of most major attractions in Sultanahmet. Numerous small groups there during my time and all seemed to be thoroughly enjoying themselves if breakfast banter was any guide. Area very safe and many restaurants within 70m of hotel. Happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: DanInABQ
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a gay-friendly hotel in Istanbul, and booked Hotel Tria on a recommendation from friends. When we arrived, the hotel staff checked that we'd meant to book a king bed, but didn't seem at all bothered. Everyone was very helpful and charming. The transfer from the airport - arranged by the hotel - went without a hitch, and I highly suggest this, even if you do not qualify for the free transfer. They also took care of booking transport for us at the end of our stay to the dock, where we were joining a cruise. The hotel is in the heart of the old town area, and in walking distance of Haggia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Basilica Cisterns, Topkapi Palace, and spice market. It is only a short walk down hill to the shore of the Bosphorus. In other words, it is ideally suited. Do make sure you are booked into the Tria Boutique Hotel - they have other properties, which don't look as well placed. Our room had been well-upgraded, with a very pleasant bathroom. The fourth-floor rooms have a view of the Bosphorus. But if you aren't booked into one of those, you'll still get panoramic views from the roof, where you can also take your breakfast, included in the room rate. The buffet breakfast was great! A range of dried and fresh fruit, local treats like halva, breads and backed goods made for a filling and satisfying start to our day. WiFi is included in the room rate, but was not easy to connect to - we had numerous disconnections. However, it was sufficient to allow us to look up opening times of museums etc, and to keep up to date with email and Facebook. I would without reservation recommend this hotel, and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “â€œBrilliant Hotel in great locationâ€�”
Reviews.Author: shannel_ch
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Tria in December .Staff was wonderful; always offered apple tea or Turkish coffea on our return to the Tria. Front desk was friendly and helpful especially Arhan Aras who helped arrange Oldcity Guide for us. The room was really cosy ; beds were comfortable and clean. The location was perfect; we could walk to many sites which was better than a tram . Hotel pick-up service to and from the airport also worked very well. Sincerely can recommend Tria hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Three Great Weeks at the Tria Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmtraveler155
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a intimate, friendly hotel where the staff is courteous and helpfi; then the Tria is the hotel for you. It is located very close to all the sites most tourists want to see in Istanbul plus the rail system is very close and convenient. We started with a week stay in the Tria then to Egypt and back to the Tria for two weeks and not once did we regret our decision to choose the Tria Hotel. It is clean, comfortable and the breakfasts which are included with the room price are among the best that we have seen. This is a great little hotel by any measure. We will visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: lucky_glennie26
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this little boutique hotel for a week broken by a side trip to Cappadocia. We were prepared to store some luggage with the hotel as the staff made us feel right at home. They just couldn't do enough to make our stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. The location within the Sultanahmet precinct is ideal as all the main attractions are within easy walking reach along with many eateries, souvenir and of course carpet shops! The rooms are clean and a good size and the water view is sensational! As the hotel is located in a back street away from the main retail strip - it provided for a relatively serene sanctuary from the constant buzz of the Sultanahmet. Thank you to Erhan, Mustafa and the Tria crew for such a memorable and delightful stay. We hope to return one day in the near future and will definitely choose Tria without hesitation! Tekshuka derim! GÃ¼le GÃ¼le!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel friendly&helpful costumer service”
Reviews.Author: Ed D
Reviews.Content: Tria Hotel between the Hagia Sohia and Blue Mosgue. Tria was recommended to us by a friend who live Istanbul made my reservation online.The star is Erhan , the front desk clerk . In his email he had welcomed us to the family, and when we arrived it felt just like that. Very nice people & very friendly to make one's stay pleasant.Erhan go out of his way every time you need something, above and beyond anything I have experienced in a hotel. he is good knowledge of the local area and are very willing to helped us book tours, gave us directions to get to different places. Arranged pick-up and return to Airport .. My room was quite spacious with a panaroma . I was traveling with my wife so having free Wifi in my room was Wewould totally recommend everyone going to Istanbul to stay at the Tria Hotel for comfortable and delightful experience. All in all, quite a positive experience at the Tria Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very recommendable”
Reviews.Author: Alejandra D
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and rellay enjoyed it. The hotel has an excellent location, just in the heart of the hystorical centre. They treated us very well, always willing to help us with any problem or questions, especially Erhan from the front desk, he was so kind and helpful with us!!! They also took us to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but average”
Reviews.Author: CarloGriante
Reviews.Content: Location of the Hotel is ideal to visit the most important monuments , the markets and for the access to the Cruise trips on the Bosphorus. Restaurant on top of the Hotel is good value and the view is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: KSWNYC
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, rooms were small but neat and comfortable, and the staff ranged from friendly and competent to extremely helpful. The hotel is quietly gay/lesbian friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Susan1120
Reviews.Content: Our room was very small and looked out onto an air shaft. The rooftop deck was closed. We were charged for water, which I thought was very tacky. We had stayed at other hotels in Turkey and water came with the room. At $150/night I did not think that this was a very good value. However, the location was excellent, walking distance to all the sites and to many cafes and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Tony S
Reviews.Content: A great location in terms of atmosphere, cafes etc and most of the famous tourist attractions. Above all, the hotel itself was great value for money with excellent food in the rooftop restaurant, a five-star self-service breakfast, and unbeatable friendliness and service from all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Most friendly and helpful staff; excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: JacintaTheHague_NL
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel as well as the friendly and efficient service of the staff made our stay most pleasant. Ideally located and within a walk to all the main attractions. An incredible view from the rooftop terrace to watch the sunrise over the Bosphorus or enjoy dinner at dusk with a view of the Blue Mosque. Standard rooms are very small and stepping into the shower stall can be treacherous. We upgraded to a deluxe room and this solved the problem however I must comment that there is poor lighting in the bathroom and you can clearly hear noises from the room above through the bathroom vent. However, these issues never hampered the enjoyment of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, the best staff!”
Reviews.Author: Helen D
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I only had the pleasure of staying in this little hotel for one night. Had my visit to Turkey not be on an organised tour with my friends, I would have definitely stayed longer at the Tria. The location of the hotel, the friendliness and hospitality of the staff, the lovely breakfast, and the amazing view from the rooftop, all added to my first impressions of Turkey. We stayed in many 5 star hotels all over Turkey, but none matched the friendliness that we received at the Tria. Well done to Serdar and his staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Claire L
Reviews.Content: Great warm welcome, very helpful with info and tips and fab location near main sights. Very comfortable bed, clean and lovely ambience on roof terrace. All staff were extremely helpful and made the whole experience really lovely. Would be even better if breakfast could be served on the roof terrace. What a wonderful start to beautiful Istanbul which I'd love to return to!

Reviews.Title: “Family Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Walid M
Reviews.Content: My wife traveled with her friends to Istanbul for 2 days on November last year, she was impressed with this nice little Hotel and friendly staff, so when we decided to visit Istanbul again as we where in 5 star hotels in Istanbul few years ago, so I decided under my wife's advise to give it a try, we traveled on Aug 27th 2011 in a vacation and truly it was a lovely experience for me. The hotel location is very good, close to the airport, also close to the important historical site's and site seeing locations which you can do on foot, and shopping around in Istanbul. The hotel has a friendly atmosphere and that was helpful in exploring this great historical city. I felt among caring people guiding me to explore their adorable city. The hotel rates are very reasonable and worth the beautiful experience you will have. On Oct 9th 2011 my wife and her sister is traveling again in a business trip to Istanbul the choice is Tria Istanbul hotel, the reservation was fast and easy and I am sure you will find all that and lots more yourself when you travel and stay in this lovely little hotel especially when you will get your dinner over the roof that overlooking the Bosphorus with panoramic view . I highly recommend this lovely Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: GC53
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better small hotels in Sultanahmet (the touristy bit of Istanbul). The location is relatively quiet, although the street itself is a bit run down. From the 4th floor rooms you can see the Golden Horn / Bosphorus (i.e. the water) and from the terrace on the 5th Floor, the Aghia Sofia and Blue Mosque dominate. Breakfast is good - lots of variety ( but I didn't see anyone trying the olives first thing in the morning). The only drawback is that it's served on the ground floor rather than the rooftop terrace. The bedrooms are not perfect. While our double bed was generous in size and very comfortable, there were no drawers or shelves at all in the room - only hanging space, which meant living partly out of suitcases for 5 nights. The curtains were at least 30% smaller than the windows, there was no plug in the sink basin (this is normal in Istanbul), and although the bath had jacuzzi nozzles, they did not work. Not good enough for a hotel which claims to be a cut above. And beware the so-called free tea/coffee in the bedrooms - the bottled supermarket water that stands invitingly next to the kettle is charged (exhorbitantly) as a minibar item! The staff at reception were laid back, pleasant and helpful. We had an unfortunate experience however that will certainly not (well, hopefully not) affect most visitors. Both my wife and I had food poisoning from a meal - NOT, I hasten to add, a meal at the Tria - and eventually we spent 24 hours in hospital. We needed to stay in Istanbul to recover, but could not remain in the Tria which was fully booked after our 5 nights were up. So we were forced to bed down (feeling pretty sick) in another hotel nearby. The owner of the Tria then refused us the free transfer to the Airport, which we would have had if we had been fit enough to travel at the end of our 5-night booking. This left us with the feeling that at the Tria customer care, praised in other customer reviews, is in fact only skin deep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent food, excellent owner”
Reviews.Author: SLoh_11
Reviews.Content: Loved the service provided. The hotel staff were helpful. The room I got was superb! It has the view of the water and the city. The hotel restaurant food was excellent. My favorite is the grilled sea bass. They have two restaurants owned by the same owner. Both are excellent. I will definitely come back to this place. The price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Patricia L
Reviews.Content: It is in an ideal location to visit the all the tourist sights and is in walking distance for public transport. The staff were most helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good and we enjoyed some lovely evening meals on the terrace with excellent service and fabulous views. The rooms are comfortable and clean. Our transfer to and from the airport was organised by the hotel and was most appreciated. We were a group of nine and made to feel most welcome. We would return to this hotel again given the opportunity. Many thanks. P.Lofthouse

Reviews.Title: “the best place to spend holiday”
Reviews.Author: supergagioaldo
Reviews.Content: beautiful place, nice and friendly staff, rich breakfast, panoramic georgous restaurant with bosforo view. the hotel is near all the pubs and bar of the old city but in spite of this rooms are silence. good sleeping. they also organize tour all over istambul and in the golden horn and bosforo staff always ready to give help. really good experence. aldo from italy

Reviews.Title: “A rooftop terrace between the Sea of Marmara, the Blue Mosque and the AyaSofya.”
Reviews.Author: Houston914
Reviews.Content: The Tria Hotel is a very pleasant and convenient place to stay for visitors interested in seeing the main tourist attractions in Istanbul. It is a few minutes walking distance from the Blue Mosque, the Ayasofya and the Topkapi Palace. Also within walking distance are the Archeological Museum and the Grand Bazaar. The rooms are simple and clean. You get a comfortable bed, a minibar, cable television and free wifi. The breakfast buffet is extensive. The option of eating on the rooftop terrace overlooking the Sea of Marmara should not be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Not good if you want to stay in a triple room”
Reviews.Author: Mariana C
Reviews.Content: We asked for a triple room when we booked through lastminute.com and when we got there there was a double bed and a pull-up bed stuck in a small room. The three of us could not even walk around. We asked the hotel staff if we could either change to a bigger room with a proper third bed, but they said there was not such a type of room. The pull-up bed was VERY uncomfortable and we then asked if they could provide another single room, but they refused saying that we would have the pay the amount. Not even a discount was given. On another note, we noticed that the room was not cleaned for a couple of days - only the bed was nicely made, but the floor and bathroom were not done every day. Although, the room was very clean when we arrived. So I am just criticising the maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilgambero
Reviews.Content: nice hotel for a good price The view from the terrace is beautiful and the reastaurant is good too. Rooms are clean even if the one back looking are a bit dark

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we have ever stayed in!!!”
Reviews.Author: liz_a_lu16
Reviews.Content: The Tria Hotel is located in the main tourist area of Istanbul, literally a stone's throw away from the Blue Mosque and Grand Palace. On our first and last night there we had dinner in their restaurant, which has a roof terrace over-looking the Golden Horn and with views of the Blue Mosque. The food was excellent and the prices were reasonable. The rooms were very comfortable with good facilities. The defining feature of this hotel has to be the staff. I have never been in a hotel where you have staff who will genuinely do anything for you and actually take an interest in you to make sure you make the most of your trip to Istanbul. We returned home having made friends with the staff and I would now love to go back and see them all again!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Alberto A
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel , the rooms are little but confortable, a wonderfoul landscape from the restautant at the top

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and excellent in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: Ruth R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and the room was very comfortable with everything you might need, even free bottles of water put in the room every day. Tea and coffee making facilities were a bonus. Clean and well equipped bathroom with plenty of hot water and even liquid soaps and shampoo provided. The breakfast was so good we didn't need any more food till early evening.

Reviews.Title: “very cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: kanka_11
Reviews.Content: Ä± have been stayed 4 nÄ±ght Ä±n thÄ±s hotel, very comfortable.staff very smÄ±ly, recetÄ±on BIROL, ERHAN they are very frÄ±endly guys, breakfast amazÄ±ng, very clean hotel, locatÄ±on really good, what else I can tell, I felt much relax than my home Thank you to them. I recommend everone. ( you dont need to spend your money for 5 star hotel and cold athnospher) just call tria hotel feel real athmospher.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: SempatiManager
Reviews.Content: What a shame we stayed there only 1 night, next time will stay minimum 3 nights, Staff was very friedly, room was good otantic, clean, area was very good, We have used Hotel Restaurant, and it was perfect I didnt want to go, I wanted seat there all night, food was perfect, I had meze and Ottoman style cassarole and Dessert, price was ok, and Service was perfect, you can watch Sunset and Bosphorus. Its magnicifent place. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, beautiful views and excellent food!”
Reviews.Author: EricLON
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tria eight nights in a Deluxe rooms on the 4th floor. Upon arrival the staff were very friendly and helpful in helping me recovering my suitcase (which somehow managed to stay in London for another 24 hours). Our room was of good size, the mattress was very comfortable, the air-conditioning worked well (quite important as we had up to 37 degrees that week) and the views on the sea were great. The Tria has a fabulous terrace with wonderful views over the Marmara sea, the Princes Islands, Kadikoy and you can even see a bit of the Bosphorus Bridge. The terrace is also a restaurant, which serves excellent food; this came quite handy after a long day of visits, as we did not feel like going out again to find a place to eat (although the street underneath has plenty of touristic restaurants; the few we tried served good food too). The staff were very friendly, helped book tours, and answer all the questions we had. However, do your research before if you have a specific tour in mind, or if you want to use a specific tour operator, as the staff will recommended a shortlist of tour operators, which they advertise for and get a commission from. The hotel is located slightly off the main street, which makes it quieter; but this is Istanbul and it is never completely quiet (you'll hear music, traffics, etc.) The only drawback for us was that the room was located under the terrace, and the terrace guests needed to pass in front our door to reach the lift (that stops a level below the terrace); a group can be quite loud going down the stairs and waiting for the lift. If you rather go to bed before midnight, pick up a room on the 3rd floor; I understand the 302 still has very good views and you will be less noisy. We will definitely consider going back at this hotel when we come back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 days stay, and would inshah'allah come again”
Reviews.Author: Aslam60
Reviews.Content: We were picked up at the airport where a hotel staff was waiting. We arrived fairly early in the morning, and were greeted by the friendly receptionist, who offere us some very good breakfast. By the time we finished eating our room was ready, and the hotel staff carried our luggage to our room. The room (including bathroom) was neat and clean and tastefully furnished. We slept for a couple of hours, and then went out to see Istanbul. The hotel staff informed us about the places of interest, most of which were within walking distance. In short we had a wonderful 4 days exploring Istanbul. The hotel finally arranged for transport to drop us to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “in the very heart of istanbul”
Reviews.Author: carlo-onofri
Reviews.Content: in the middle of sultanahmet, quiet, friendly, gorgeus breakfast, good staff

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would return!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Suzannah1999
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel. Roof top terrace was one of the best in the area ( and there were a lot) Service, prices and location was first class. Would definitely recommend spalshing out on the larger room, as others were quite small ( we were luckily upgraded due to a small admin mistake)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: phaedras25
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Istanbul at the tail end of a 3 week trip. The staff at Tria helped me make the most out of a very short stay, got me great prices on outings and fed me lots of tea. highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views...”
Reviews.Author: VerityK
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here at the end of our 2 week trip. Great little hotel right in the thick of the action. Perfectly located to explore Aya Sofia, blue mosque on foot and close to tram stops for any trips over the water. Although bars and resturants very close by this is in a side street so away from the majority of the noise. Also for the first time wasn't woken by any early morning call to prayers! Room was larger than expected with a giant double bed and jacuzzi bath (added bonus after a long day siteseeing!) and had everything you'd expect. Though note bottles of water left on the side are not free! Staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast offered a good choice. We didn't try the resturant but the view from the terrance was stunning and staff even gave us pashminas to keep out the chill. All in all a good place to stay. Added bonus of free airport transfer if you stay 3 or more nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: onomataho
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here. Easy to walk to most of the major tourist attractions in the old city. Tram was close by, too. Older hotel with nice decor. Bed & linens vary good. WiFi in room. Excellent continental breakfast with Turkish specialties. Friendly, helpful staff. Do know that the big bottle of water placed on the desk is not free ($2us). Single room (with double bed) was small (shower small, too).

Reviews.Title: “i did feel very very well in Tria Hotel”
Reviews.Author: annagi2003
Reviews.Content: Very very good locations in all sense : very quiet street to sleep well, rooms and baths perfect, good breakfast , staff kind and friendly, 5 minutes walking to all monuments , delightfull terraze with nice view of Bosforus and excellent restourant. Of course i'll be back to Tria hotel in my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “All night bar noise”
Reviews.Author: Riveright
Reviews.Content: We were given a room in the annex behind the hotel on a very busy street. Our room, while very nice, faced the street. We stayed a Friday and Saturday night, and the noise from the bars across the street kept us awake until 3 a.m. Even with the windows closed and ear plugs, the noise was deafening. When we complained about the noise Saturday morning, they said the noise the night before was because of the football game and that it would be quiet after midnight. It was not. Unless you plan to stay out all night, beware of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: swinjordan
Reviews.Content: Overnight flights and morning arrivals are not usually the best start - HOWEVER - the team at Tria Hotel change all that. I arrived at 8.45am having had no sleep, after a warm welcome I was invited to have a complimentary breakfast and promised that once I was finished my room would be ready ...and it was. My room was not very spacious or bright but, it was clean and comfortable - and free wireless internet (a computer is provided close to reception if you don't have your laptop/iPad etc). The view from the roof terrace was lovely - and even though it had not officially opened during my stay, the staff were happy to bring me a drink and make sure I was looked after. The service was great throughout my stay. The hotel is in a great location - 5 mins walk (at most) from Topkapi Palace - everything is within walking distance. The food in the hotel's restaurant around the corner is delicious and the service is fantastic - Levent's directions and advice meant I easily managed to explore and get know a number of areas away from the main tourist areas on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine Hospitality, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelboy82
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Tria Hotel Istanbul. Location: In the Roman Settlement Village area (Akbiyik Street) the location is perfect. 3min to Blue Mosque/Haga Sophia/Topkapi Palace, 1min to amazing bars/cafe's, but yet just around the corner so none of the late night music disturbs. The Sultanahmet Metro station and Grand Bazaar are both only a few minutes walk away. Service: The service from all staff in the hotel was truly genuine. A small hotel with only about 20rooms, the reception staff adress you by name, and takes a genuine interest in how your day was. Always on hand to offer a cup of coffee or a coke as you wait for a transfer etc. As a very frequent business traveller (gold member on most chain hotel frequent guest programme) it was amazing to have some genuine-from-the-heart hospitality for a change. Rooms: The rooms are basic, but well kept, and well stocked with amenities such as mini bar, comfortable bedding, aircon and bathrobes. The signature lavender pouch on your pillow was a nice, homely touch. Breakfast: Although small, it offers a good selection for a hotel in this price range. There are various cakes, pastries and jams. Also a hot selection with some cocktail sausages and boiled eggs. Juice and coffee were plentiful and always replenished. The attention to detail once again runs through with home made jams and a honey bar. Terrace: As the tourist season is only starting in Istanbul now, the roof top terrace bar was not yet open, but offers a welcome retreat for sundowners, with birds eye views of the rooftops down to Kennedy Caddesi and the water below. I think in summer a place to spend many a balmy night with drinks just soaking in the atmosphere. Please do not expect a 5* Ritz or Four Seasons experience, but the hotel offers an EXCELLENT location, GENUINE service and GREAT value for money. Attention to details is great for this price range too. If you are an average traveller on a 3 or 4 day city break to Istanbul this is an absolute gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, perfect location, spotless and comforable rooms, superb breakfast”
Reviews.Author: awj2011
Reviews.Content: I booked Tria Hotel as a part of a vacation package, and my fiancee and I were extremely content and happy with this choice. The staff is very friendly, helpful, responsive and kind. The hotel itself is very clean, nonsmoking, nicely decorated and very comfortable. The bed was roomy, the pillows were soft, the bathroom was clean, the minibar was stocked. Like any small hotel, you can hear passerby in the halllway, but all of the other guests were quiet and respectful. The neighborhood is especially great for first time visitors to Istanbul. The hotel can help arrange for an airport pickup/drop off service, who were punctual and patient. There is an amazing view from the rooftop terrace, which is a luxury to walk up to and relax in the sun. And last but not least, Tria offers an amazing complimentary breakfast buffet. Many choices of fresh food were available and it was a great way to start the day. Only tips I have for travelers: bring your own shampoo and conditioner and bring a travel alarm clock since there was no clock in the room (nice for vacation....) No complaints from these travelers! Tria made for a lovely, relaxing getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mavi2011
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful experience staying at the Tria Hotel for 6 nights. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. The view from the terrace is breathtaking. On the last night we were upgraded to a deluxe room with a view of the bosphorus. I could not stop looking out of the window as it was really beautiful. If you can wake up early it is a must to see the sunrise on a clear day. Wow! Location is unbeatable. The hotel is walking distance to the blue mosque, Haghia Sophia, train station, trams, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern, museums, shops and restaurants. The staff were absolutely brilliant and very helpful. They really wanted you to feel comfortable and relaxed. My parents were treated with so much respect and honour. When we return to Istanbul we would love to stay at the Tria again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DarjaSant_Petersburg
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff, peerless kitchen ... The range of the Turkish cuisine and the European ... Very stylish interior, a respectful attitude of the staff and, perhaps, the most delicious food around Istanbul! Tria is low-priced hotel with excellent service, located near the main attractions in Sultanahmet and have Beautiful views on Blue Mosque from windows - Here you find everything that you need fo good holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the hart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Crysader
Reviews.Content: Tria Hotel has a great location in the old city center. It is in 5 minutes work from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. It is located in the touristic area which gives you and advantage to enjoy different bars and restaurants as well as the conventional shops. From the hotel roof terrace and some rooms you can enjoy the Bosporus view. Although this means that you can be disturbed by the ships during night. Rooms are nice and clean, but not very large. The sound insulation is also not always perfect. Breakfast is quite good. With no doubt the second commodity of the hotel after the location is the staff. The hotel stuff is very helpful and reliable. You can be sure that they will do everything they can to address your request. I am not sure that this hotel is the best choice for a family with small kids, but from my point of view it is very good choice for a couple without kids.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading website. Over-priced rooms. Rude Manager.”
Reviews.Author: RobinMadden
Reviews.Content: We just checked in (new year's eve 2010) to our delux double room here which we booked on the Tria website having been taken by the photos of the "Delux Room". But now feel so disenchanted that the first thing we've done is take out my laptop and write this review. Our room was quite a long way short of what the website implied our 180â‚¬ would get; a restricted view of the Bosphorus between 2 buildings, two hard single beds pushed together to make a "double" and a jacuzzi which wasn't large enough for me (let alone two people) in a small, dark, windowless bathroom. After explaining to the manager that we thought the room wasn't all it had been hyped up to be and requested to be moved to the 4th floor delux room (ours was the 2nd floor) we had been promised by the website, he became rude and abrupt and refused to acknowledge the website's misleadings. He refused to compromise or offer us anything in consolation and wouldn't let us cancel our booking. In all honesty, the rooms are fine, clean if a little without charater and the other staff were perfectly friendly and polite. We were just incredibly disappointed with the value for money that the room presented and by the manager's attitude. P.S. judging from the floor plans the standard rooms look very small.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amanimalhas
Reviews.Content: Tria Hotel is a charming hotel with an excellent location for the prime historical sites and for shopping , all are within walking distance , great value for your money . The hotel is clean and the food is excellent . Last but not least the friendly staff who managed to make us feel at home in every way possible and special thanks to the manager for helping us always.

Reviews.Title: “TRIA HOTEL, Great Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: MSEm2
Reviews.Content: After researching hotels on Trip Advisor, I choose the TRIA Hotel for our last 5 nights in Istanbul. It is a small hotel and TOTALLY NON SMOKING. Because we had a 5 night stay, we had a top floor room overlooking the sea. The A/C unit is the room kept the room cool. Great king size bed. Also 2 easy chairs with a small table. On the table was a welcome bottle of Turkish red wine and fresh fruit. The bath was a nice size with a big tub/shower combo. Actually the tub as a corner spa tub. There was also a single cup coffee pot and hot water pot with a good selection of coffees and teas. We also left a 2 TLira tip for the maids each day. They made sure had extra fresh towels, water bottles, coffee and tea Also a nice breakfast was included. Because we had been on a tour before our arrival at the Tria, the management treated us to a wonderful 5 course dinner with wine at their restaurant (about 1 block away). We actually when back to the restruant (in side with white table clothes, etc) for dinner our last night .During our stay at the Tria , 2 half day tours were included in our package. The wonderful meal was substituted for the tours. The Tria is in a great location for walking to all of the old city sights. Also you can walk over to take the bus to other locations. There was also a little store at the end of the block. The store was a great place to pick up cold drinks and snacks. There are a lot of places for reasonable priced lunches and dinners 1 block from the hotel. I was worried about the number of hostels in the area, but the bands shut down at 11 PM. I would definitely looking at staying at the Tria for another trip to Istanbul. Our tour had us staying at the Ritz in Istanbul. Although the Ritz was more luxurious the service and location and price of the Tria would be hard to beat. The Ritz had a great buffet breakfast included in our tour package, but the location in not good for touring or for lunch and dinner locations. I hope to travel to Istanbul again and I would definitely look at staying at the Tria again.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional service, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: gakyi
Reviews.Content: because this is a newer hotel, it was not yet listed in any of my guidebooks -- after i found that my guidebook hotel picks were already booked 6 weeks in advance, i luckily stumbled across this place online -- and am very glad i did. our room was clean and tasteful, and when we arrived, there were sachets on the pillows -- which typifies the small but meaningful amenities that make this hotel stand apart from others in the Sultanahmet area. the bathroom was sleek, and there were bathrobes and slippers offered along with the plush towels. the breakfast spread is exceptional, including a honeycomb that provided fresh natural honey. the view from the roof terrace is wonderful, and the friendly cat that sleeps beside the entrance made us feel at home, and the staff here were always helpful with giving us directions, phoning restaurant reservations and arranging transport. the rooms are small - depending upon which one you are in -- but i know this is typical of most hotels in this area, having visited before. also, be careful on the stairs -- some of the steps risers are at odd heights. other than this, we had no complaints... the location is excellent, being in a back corner on a closed street, away from the busier (and noisier) backpacker row.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice staff, very convenient location, good deal overall!”
Reviews.Author: malaf
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Istanbul for our first time and spent 5 nights at this hotel. This hotel is very conveniently located, in the Sultanahmed area, within short walking distance of many major sites (Blue Mosque, St Sophia, Grand Bazar, Topkapi Palace and the tramway to get to Galata). We were very pleased to see how hospitable the staff at the Tria Hotel were. They generously answered all our questions on how to get around in the city, they were very polite, they did everything to ensur that we have a pleasant stay. We benefited from the free pickup and drop off service from and to Ataturk Airport. This was very convenient, especially since we had to get to the airport at 5:00 am on a Sunday morning for our return flight. A cab ride would have been rather expensive. This hotel has two buildings, one is located on a rather main/touristy street, with deluxe rooms, and the other (where the reception desk is), is on a smaller street on the other side of the block. Both buildings are nice, with rooftop terrasses. We stayed in the first building, our room was really nice, despite being a little small (but we litterally were only there to sleep, since the rest of the day was spent visiting). The Tria Hotel staff ensured the room was maintained on a daily basis. Finally, the only drawback was that, since this is a busy area at night, the noise from the surrounding restaurants/bars got into our room until at least 11:00 pm which, however, was nothing that a good pair of earplugs could not solve. Ask for a quieter room if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel, near Topaki palace,views of Bosphorus amazing.”
Reviews.Author: Iddap
Reviews.Content: Tria hotel near the Topaki Palace, just off a busy touristy road, is a little haven of peace and quiet. We had rooms overlooking the Bosphorus,(we enjoyed watching the huge ships, going to the Black Sea and back.) There is a little restaurant on the roof of the Tria where we enjoyed our first Turkish meal. A great location with friendly and helpful staff. We had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Lot Going For It, With Some "Buts"”
Reviews.Author: karlthelawyer
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were quite pleased with our stay at the Tria Hotel. The staff were all helpful and were able to arrange everything we requested (including a room change - more on that shortly). The breakfast was above average, with a variety of meats, cheeses, breads, and pastries as well as Ã§ay, coffee, and other tasty morsels. On the rooms, here's the catch - the rooms in the back of the building have windows facing another building (i.e. no sunlight). The rooms on the front of the building, while light, open onto the street and are noisier from the guests sitting out front talking until all hours as well as music from a hostel across the street. Only a problem if you're a light sleeper, but worth flagging. And do be sure not to be stuck in the smallest room of the hotel (which is only slightly larger than a broom closet) - we initially were but requested another which was accomplished at no charge. Rooms are small-ish, but get used to it in Turkey. The location is excellent, being in the heart of the Sultanahmet district. A great first place to stay, even if the area is 100% touristy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Rooms Tiny”
Reviews.Author: Kazmartin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in August 2010 with husband and 17 year old daughter. We had triple room which was tiny but we were hardly in room.There was a small breakfast buffett. The terrace has excellent views of istanbul and the hotel is short walk to Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar. We used Sabinha Goecken airport which most travel guides say takes 1hour 30 mins to reach Sultanhmet but it only took about 40 mins so we were very early at airport.

Reviews.Title: “For old istanbul, a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: trickymiki55
Reviews.Content: We absolutely adored this place. The terrace, breakfast, the upgraded room and the service were first class. If you want to stay in Sultanahmed, stay here. Being 30-somethings though, everyone was a little older and when we returned to Istanbul we wanted to stay closer to Beyoglu.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Walking distance to major sights!”
Reviews.Author: Elle0
Reviews.Content: On a recent visit to Istanbul with my girlfriends we stayed in Tria Hotel. The staff was very helpful and nice indeed and helped us arrange restaurant and private guide bookings. The terrace is magnificient with a superb view over the sea and the major sights (blue mosque, Haga Sofia, Topkapi Palace etc). Rooms are nice and practical and the Hotel is very quiet! The food was good (had dinner on the terrace once) - it would be nice if one could have breakfast up there as well (which you can if you carry your tray upstairs). All in all we had a great time and Tria was the perfect choice to be in walking distance of the big sights. If you want to see more of the modern Istanbul on the Asian side - the traffic can be a bit of a drag. Would definitely recommend! Ellen

Reviews.Title: “Small but fine”
Reviews.Author: Awal10
Reviews.Content: Tria is a small but fine hotel in Sultanahmet - just few steps from the major tourist attractions of the old Istanbul. The hotel is quite small but has everything you need - nicely decorated rooms, clean bathroom, free internet access, and delicious Turkish breakfast: ship cheese, olives, grilled vegatables, dried fruit, baklava and other kinds of Turkish cakes and pastries. The staff speaks decent English and is very helpful in arranging transport or booking restaurants, whirling dervishes shows and other attractions. The only disadvantage is that there is a kind of a disco on the roof of one of the hotels nearby, so it is quite noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice hotel in the historic center”
Reviews.Author: joanna102
Reviews.Content: Tria is a small but nice hotel in the vicinity of major historic sites: Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace. Personnel is very helpful and speaks good English. The breakfast buffet with delicious Turkish sweets, ship cheese and fresh vegetables was great. Unfortunatelly, there is a kind of a disco on one of the terraces nearby so it was quite loud in the room during night, but we were so tired after the all-day walking tours that it did not bother us much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: Geo28374
Reviews.Content: As long as you don't need the ambiance of The Four Seasons, this is a great little boutique hotel. One building has five rooms per floor and the other building two per floor. You are two or three blocks downhill from Hagia Sophia and Topkapi. The lobby is small to non-existent, but it has tables for breakfast in one building and a full restaurant in the other. Our rooms had king beds and small but clean and modern bathrooms. The internet always worked. The staff is friendly (especially if you are friendly to them). Their roof top dining area has views of Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus area. The main hotel is one block off of a very busy cafe filled street, while the other building is on that street. It is not The Four Seasons, and it is not as "artsy" as the Empress Zoe (50 meters down the road), but definitely met our needs. We would definitely consider staying here again. The only real negative is that there are a number of hostels nearby, and one of them had loud music going until about 11:30 or so on one of our three nights - coming right into our window. But the good news is that there is a music curfew of some sort, and so they shut down before we were ready to try to sleep, thus no disturbance at all. The other two nights - no music at all.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: vegetarian-girl
Reviews.Content: my husband and i were there for 2 nights. we stayed in a separate building, away from the main B&B but it was nice, facing the street and cafes, and above their restaurant. the room was infused with lavender scent and had a pretty little balcony from where i can see the blue mosque and hagia sophia. the location is wonderfully convenient, and the breakfast on the terrace was fantastic. we highly recommend the tria.

Reviews.Title: “They are providing first class services”
Reviews.Author: Hatef
Reviews.Content: Last year I went to Tria hotel for a week and I had a great time, I think itâ€™s the best recommendation for travelers to Istanbul, I found it very clean, really comfortable and very friendly Staffs. I wish to comeback there. -- BR/Rasoul

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: AnandLondon
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for 5 nights. We had a really good time. The breakfast could have been a bit more varied but there can't be any complaints about the quality though. The beds were comfortable, the staff friendly and the service really good. I would surely recommend this place. The area is also bang in the centre of Sultanahmet - and very close to all the major sight seeing areas. The staff at receptionist are very helpful in giving you hints, tips and suggestions for sight seeing trips. We asked in advance for a quiet room and this was obliged (We heard that the rooms facing the street could be noisy with music from the nearby bars). Also, the roof terrace is currently closed for renovation. Tria's restaurant was good but could do with more variety for vegetarians. Nevertheless, I would surely recommend this place for its budget matched with quality

Reviews.Title: “A true paradise”
Reviews.Author: Olissia
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! To be honest, the best one I've ever stayed at. Perfect location, nice and cozy rooms, wide range of amenities and well-trained staff. Everything a tourist needs for pleasure and business. A very good hotel, indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy friendly and local.”
Reviews.Author: BiancaBahrain
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in winter when it was much cheaper and we really loved it. We had great views spacious rooms and happy friendly staff. the walls were paper thin so if you like screaming don't stay here because you will upset the other guests.

Reviews.Title: “A real disappointment! Certainly not 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: FMMMMMMMMMMMMM
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our stay in Tria Hotel - in fact, it was the only disappointment of our trip to Istanbul. For starters, it's certainly not a 4 star hotel - we were looking forward to a relaxing week, staying somewhere comfortable and a little luxurious. The hotel rooms are fine with particularly good sheets - I would describe them as like a high-end guesthouse. The hotel is small and in a relatively good location but it backs onto a street with bars and restaurants. We were put in one of these lesser back rooms upon arrival. When we tried to go to sleep we realised we were backing onto a nightclub which played loud music until 3:45am. We're pretty young and chilled but were exhausted and not happy when neither of us got any sleep the first night. Despite several calls to reception nothing was done to help. After some resistence, we moved rooms to the front of the hotel the next morning and these were fine but still very noisy. You could hear anything happening in the corridors and the loud voices of staff at reception making calls and greeting guests well after 1am each night. The Tria website is a bit of a stretch beyond reality and while you can go out on the roof - it certainly doesn't seem to have a roof top restaurant as you are designed to think from the photos! In terms of good points - the location was easy for access and the breakfast buffet was fine. To sum up - Tria Hotel would be fine if they were holding themselves out as a guesthouse but a massive disappointment as a supposed 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer luxury in every way”
Reviews.Author: Mylargirl
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at the Tria for two nights, but I wish I had stayed longer. It was a wonderful experience. It is located very centrally in the heart of Sultanahmet. First of all, when I got there the receptionist made me some Turkish tea and sat and chatted with me about Istanbul, giving me some helpful advice on sightseeing and tours, as well as telling me about Turkish history. Then, he took me to my room and I was very impressed! I had only paid for a single room, but luckily all the other singles were booked out, and I got the deluxe suite. It was beautiful and extremely comfortable, with classic-style polished wood Turkish furniture and a very fancy modern bathroom, with a spa-bath. The morning Turkish breakfast buffet is also a don't-miss. It was far above and beyond my expectations, and very good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what I expected”
Reviews.Author: eldelErbil
Reviews.Content: Perhaps if you pay the top rate and book a deluxe room this hotel would be okay, but as a solo traveler in a "standard room"-definitely NOT. The standard rooms overlook a backyard shared by a noisy bar or disco and your view consists of air conditioning units and balconies full of garbage...then there is the noise from same and the high priced restaurants (not very good) in the neighborhood. There is no roof top terrace, you eat breakfast in the same dark basement room as the reception. As to the service, it's not terrible, but they have this THING about wake up calls-they just don't do them, even though they promise you they will-EVERY MORNING, then deny they didn't make them. They also charge you for calls you didn't make. It's not a terrible hotel, just not that great and one could probably find one just as good elsewhere for the same money. Come to think of it, I did and it had a view and roof top breakfast room with an even better view. Service there was also fine and they didn't advertise so extensively.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a very nice location”
Reviews.Author: bv123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only two nights but I can say this is a great place, the rooms are nice and the staff is very friendly. Breakfast was also very good, and so is the location. I can't really find any flaws, will sure stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: WayneCambridgeUK
Reviews.Content: Could not ask for more from this hotel. I was worried at first as the taxi had problems finding the hotel which was down a small side street but once inside everything was fine. In fact the location was perfect as it was very quiet with no traffic to disturb you. A hot drink was offered even before we checked in and than the desk clerk offered us quite a few tips on things to see and do during our stay. The breakfast each morning was one of the best I have seen with so much on offer. Our room was spacious, comfortable and clean. Everybody at this hotel went out of their way to ensure our stay was a pleasant stay without any of the problems sometimes associated with hotels. The other great thing about this hotel was the location. All the major sights were in a very short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: canary063
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights there with my mother in a standard double room. We were going to go for one of the best rated places on tripadvisor but I'm so glad we chose Tria. Our rate was fantastic and the room was much better than expected. Though we do not stay at fancy places. Breakfast was amazing- and I'm still missing it 2 months later. Staff was so helpful too. By the way we used the phone to call overseas once (stupid credit card not working) and we did not get ripped off. Really- this hotel was so nice and cozy- my mom wants to go back to Istanbul in the summer and there is no doubt she'll stay at Tria. The only thing I didn't like was that the view from our room was just a gap between two buildings- so no sun and no view. But you know what- we didn't pay for the view either. Bathroom was nice, we even had a half bathtub thing- but no drain-plug. Anyway- yes we trusted this place, it was very clean, throughly enjoyed it and would highly, highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Warning”
Reviews.Author: Rose1361
Reviews.Content: DO not use their room telephone at all,they have their own phone system and at the end they will cheat on you by adding extra minutes and unknown telephone numbers to your bill. i got almost 300$ telephone bill.I have contacted a friend lawyer to find out about my real bill and i will sue them for such a thivery.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly hotel where they know how to treat you well”
Reviews.Author: pedrostar
Reviews.Content: There were two tria hotels located back to back. My partner and I stayed in the more modern looking building. On the ground floor was the restaurant that you had to walk through to get to your room. Breakfast was served in the older charming looking building, where a delicious selection of various Turkish specialities were on offer as well as the usual cereals/bread/jam/juices etc. Room was fantastic; spacious, clean and modern, offering a view of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. There was also a roof terrace from where you had views over the sea and a clearer view of the mosques. Staff were exceptionally friendly and took great care of us. An endless supply of turkish black tea and great discussion. I was even fortunate enough to be invited to participate in a football match the hotel were hosting one evening. The hotel is centrally located with quite a few of the most popular cultural attractions within walking distance: Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, local Hamams etc. Places such as Taksin for nightlife and shopping are only a short and very affordable taxi journey away. Price was very decent outside of peak season, booked together with flights at a german travel agency. Beware of rain in December though :) All in all a very highly recommendable hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: Piwiiliam
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Tria Hotel, Istanbul in mid- December 2009. It is very close to the Blue Mosque and Sofia Hagia. But what sets this hotel apart is the friendly and helpful staff. It is not a big hotel, which is the way I like it. I enjoyed the ample and tasy breakfasts and the cosy and pleasant atmosphere. For me it was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: michmom24
Reviews.Content: Our three-night stay at the Tria was a very pleasant experience. The location can't be beat, just a short walk to the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofya. We were greeted warmly at reception upon arrival and given suggestions of how to spend our time in Istanbul. The breakfast buffet was very good. The only drawback was the room which we were given the first night was very small for three people, but the staff was very accommodating and moved us to a larger room the next day.

Reviews.Title: “This randomly chosen hotel exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: LondonJar
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on price and its central location. When I reached Istanbul the place was a pleasant surprise. The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and well appointed and the breakfast tasty. If I return to this city I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Rashizzle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tria Hotel for one week over the new year and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location was second-to-none, as we were able to walk to all of the major tourist attractions in Sultanahmet, Eminonu, the Bazaar district, and even as far as Taksim Square. We had a great view of the Bosphorous from our room (we were on the fourth floor), and easy access to the roof top for great views of the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and the Bosphorous. Breakfast each morning was plentiful with a wide variety of selections to choose from. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room itself was cozy, not overly large, with a king size bed (which was very comfortable). The only problem we had with the room was a lavendar scent from we assumed either the cleaning products or an air freshener which was at times a bit strong. Otherwise, the room was clean, secure and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice. We would definitely recommend it to others.”
Reviews.Author: Anastasia_Patras
Reviews.Content: We have stayed to Tria Hotel for 4 nights. It is a small, comfortable and clean hotel, perfectly situated to monuments as the Blue Mosque, Agia Sophia, Hippodrome, Top Capi Palace and the Cistern. It is about a five-minute-walk from all these and the tram station.Shops, cafes, restaurants and a bakery are just a breath away from the hotel. Breakfast was very good with a variety of things to choose from. The staff was polite and helpful. The only disadvantages were that it was very hot at night (but you could open the window if you wanted to) and there was no view from the windows (but we were out all day, so that wasn't a problem to us!)

Reviews.Title: “comfort central”
Reviews.Author: travelbugPenang
Reviews.Content: Our five day stay at the Tria hotel was a great start to our two week trip around Turkey and a wonderful base from which to explore Istanbul. The staff were welcoming and helpful and really made us feel at home. breakfast was tasty and very fresh. Our delux room was warm and cosy after long cold days of walking around the city. One downside it was hard to find good restuarants in the old town and we ended up travelling across the river every night for dinner, but the tram stop was an easy walk away so was not too bad. Definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully located boutique hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: AduffOttawa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Tria Hotel for eight days (November 22 - 30, 2009). We were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and wanted a comfortable and pleasant small hotel experience in the heart of historic Istanbul. The Tria Hotel more than met this requirement. We enjoyed a large deluxe double room on the third floor that provided a glimpse of the Bosphorous. The room had wood parquet floors, simple but attractive furnishings, small TV and a bathroom wtih jacuzzi tub. Most importantly, there were two wing-back chairs with stools were we could relax when planning our next day's activities. The complementary breakfast on the main floor (which was below street level) offered a range of cereals, fruits, nuts, meats, cheese and sweets. In all our dealings with the hotel staff, both before our arrival (when we were making arrangements) and during our stay (when we had questions about local attractions), we were dealt with in a friendly and helpful manner. Within a minute or two walk from the hotel one could enjoy all of the charms of the historic Sultanthament area: the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome, Bosphorous, restaurants, shops, etc. What more could one ask for when visiting a country to enjoy its cultural traditions and attractions? Given the hotel's location, with our bedroom windows open, we could hear the river traffic on the Bosphorous and the calls to prayer from the nearby Blue Mosque. While this took a bit of adjustment the first night (the call to prayers began at 05:00 a.m., and the river fog horns could last all night at 10 second intervals when there is fog), we found by the second or third night that we slept to morning undisturbed. Even during the period that we were adjusting to the sounds of our surroundings, we found them charming reminders that we were indeed in an exotic and otherwordly place. As for the food, I enjoyed every morning a bowl of ceral, one hard boiled egg, a sausage, toast, and a wedge of honey comb. The sliced meats and cheese did not appeal to me and so I left them alone. To sum up, the Tria Hotel provided a delightful base from which we were able to enjoy the wonders of Istanbul. We hope not to have to wait to our 50th wedding anniversary in order to return.

Reviews.Title: “Tria is a one of a kind hotel in a one of a kind city.”
Reviews.Author: roxtar512
Reviews.Content: While not expecting too much other than a base for our sightseeing we were overwhelmed by the hospitality, comfort, and amenities of the Tria Hotel. The rooms were lovely and comfortable with beautiful furnishings. The staff, from the managers to the cleaning staff were all friendly and accesssable. The location was perfect for seeing the old city and had easy access to the tram to get to the new city. And the breakfast buffett was amazing. Fresh breads and fruits and cheeses and granola and dried fruit and nuts... so good. I hihgly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable”
Reviews.Author: charnsi
Reviews.Content: Positive - Close to Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque - Close to tram stop - Hearty breakfast Negative - Small room with a smell - Final bill in Turkish Lira

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the middle of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our Turkey trip and it was a wonderful hotel to finish up in. We had a room that faced the main street and I believe these are the newer rooms which was good. The room itself is typical European size (ie quite small) and it had a small balcony facing the street but not enough room to sit out on. The bathroom was nice, with a spa bath and they also provided robes! Our room was on the top floor and I was a bit worried about the noise as we were facing the street but once we closed the door to the balcony you could hardly hear anything. The only downfall with our room was that it had a connecting door to the room next door and so it meant we could hear them talking and watching tv etc. The door knob was also broken and hanging off (it actually fell off on our last day) however it had another latch lock which made it secure. The only other issue with the hotel was that my brother and sister-in-laws room didn't have a full curtain, it only had the 'decorative' one which didn't cover the whole window so it meant it got bright quite early for them. However, these are just little things and they certainly won't dampen my experience at the hotel. Because we had the room facing the main street we had to walk downstairs, outside and around to the back of the building to get to the breakfast area (and main part of the hotel) but the fact that we had a nicer room than on that side made it ok (I know the rooms on that side weren't as good as my brother and his wife stayed here after they went on a tour when they re-booked into the Tria). The roof terrace is great and they even give you a shawl if you get a bit chilly. They have waiter service up there so you don't have to go down to get your drinks. I have read some reviews that have said the location is bad, however we thought it was fantastic! It's right on one of the main streets of Sultanahmet where all the restaurants are and is within walking distance of most of the old town. The tram (not that we used it) isn't far away either. The staff were great - very helpful. However be careful when making plans with them - make sure you get a confirmation! My brother and sister-in-law wanted to book a third night as they were staying longer and they thought they had arranged it with a staff member on the first day, however when myself and my husband checked out they were told they had to check out too as they were fully booked and didn't have a room for them. The staff were very helpful in finding alternative accommodation and did give them a discount for their next stay (3 days later when they got back from a tour), however they were disappointed that they had to move out of their room into another hotel for one night when they thought they had confirmed it. There is so much to do and see in Istanbul and I would have liked more time there. We spent nearly a whole day at the grand bazaar and once we bought our first item there we asked the man if he knew anyone who was selling the other things we were looking for and then he pretty much took us around to everything we needed (I think that everyone is related or knows everyone in the stalls) and made sure we got the best price from them. One thing to make sure you are aware though is that the cheaper ceramics there contain lead so can't be used for foodstuffs (we learned this after buying some!). Overall I think the Tria is a great place to stay in Istanbul and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: travellingcampbells
Reviews.Content: We planned our honeymoon 1 week before we left home and planned everything over the internet and the good old LP guide. Tria Hotel was in the LP and after reading great reviews on TA we decided to book. Luckily there was room and we were pleasantly surprised by it. We are arrived to a warm welcome and breakfast was offered immediately at no extra charge. Very welcome after a terrible flight with Turkish Airlines. The location was perfect, on a quiet side street. We booked a standard room, which was small but great and was very good value for money. Loved the dressing gowns and slippers! My only complaint it s that the noise of the air conditioning vents outside were loud but I am a light sleeper, it didn't bother my husband. I did not mention it to the staff but wish I had as when we checked out another man asked to change rooms for the same reason. I would suggest the Superior rooms as they are slightly bigger and on the road side, away from the vents! If you are in a Superior room then I would also request a room above the 1st floor as first floor windows open on street level and could be noisy. The staff were really helpful with everything. Sadly they suggested the Istanbul Balik Restaurant for a romantic dinner for two. The food was good but a total rip off and we left with a very bad taste in our mouth after paying the bill. (reviewed separately) The amount we paid for our meal could of easily paid for a Superior room at the Tria. All in all we had a great stay and would recommend it to anyone.
