Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, good location, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: madams2
Reviews.Content: Smart hotel tucked away off a side street in a very central location. The staff were very approachable and helpful in regard to trip advice, use of public transport etc and the rooms were very clean and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “very famÄ±lÄ±ar and well located”
Reviews.Author: gabrito8666
Reviews.Content: rooms are comfortable. maybe a bÄ±t small but really cleaned. the locatÄ±on Ä±s central Ä±n sultanhamed. the area Ä±s safe and full of shops

Reviews.Title: “Great little spot”
Reviews.Author: Lucles
Reviews.Content: Having been to Istanbul previously for business, I had always stayed in the big chain hotels in the business district, so on tis trip as a tourist, decided to go with the more touristy location. I chose the Tria based on the positive reviews it received on TripAdvisor, and I was not disapointed. It is a great little gem. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. The reception and other staff are very helpful, and always smiling, which goes such a long way. It is in Sultanahment, so within walking distance of many of the well known sights. The only negative I would give, was the hotel advertises a roof top terrace. Which it has, but there is no bar / restarant on top. The chap at reception did say that if you wanted a meal, you could arrange with him at the beginning of the day, and it could be organised. However we were hoping for cocktails on the roof terrace - which was not achieved.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Voozman
Reviews.Content: I have traveled the world in my life and have learned to expect acomodations similar to the local landscape. Of course you can find top of the line hotel in almost every city in the world. The Tria hotel was a great hotel for the location in the old part of the city in Istanbul. THe staff was really great and the hotel served all of our needs. Can I complain that the room was small or the bathroom was tiny of course but you cannot expect this type of room in this part of the city. I have rated this hotel based upon the cleanliness and friendly staff. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the internet worked great. If you visit to Istanbul to sightsee you will not spend so much time in hotel room so the Tria was great for the price. I highly reccomend this hotel to anyone who will understand this part of the city accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: LoveIstanbul9
Reviews.Content: The Tria Hotel is located in the perfect Istanbul neighborhood, Sultanahmet, close to Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and many neighborhood eateries and watering holes. The service was fantastic, with the staff always on the ready to help in any way they could. We traveled with 7 people, and always had something going on...the Tria really stepped up to make our stay lovely and comfortable. Beautiful rooftop terrace, too, overlooking the sea on one side and the mosques on the other. All in all, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: giclee
Reviews.Content: great hotel! warm, friendly, helpful staff. breakfast was healthy, varied and extensive. great location to the main sites, and lots of cafe's, restaurants. highly recommended for the budget/mid range traveler.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely and personal experience with Tria Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: qinqin
Reviews.Content: I found Tria (the new one) while strolling down on the Akbiyik Cad exploring Istanbul, and was attracted by its cute and chic design at first. Then, when their F&B Director, invited me for a room inspection, I was impressed with his enthusiasm and warm hospitality. A few days later, I checked in and all their staffs truly made me feel at home the whole time I was there (9 nights in total).., from casual conversation over a cup of Cha in the morning, to a strong Turkish coffee in the afternoon, or a taste of Raki in the evening (for better digestion!).. The interior design of new Tria is modern, simple and lovely. All rooms are equipped with jacuzzi! I had a great view from the little balcony in my room facing the street, could even see Blue Mosque and St. Sophia! You can always feel a nice vibe from the street, from the mornign till late at night. Young travellers and all the owners or employees working in hotels, restaurants, bars on Akiyik Cad know one another, like a lovely neighbourhood that you have long forgotten... Also, it's really easy to find some little bars or restaurants for dining and wining.. just downstairs! The food served in Tria is also very delicious and yum-yum.. Also, Tria is conveniently located in Sultanahmet, you may walk to Blue Mosque or St. Sophia in 5 min, then go visit Grand Bazzar in another 15 min walk... I know I will choose to stay at Tria again for my next trip in Istanbul and I sugget you to try it, too!

Reviews.Title: “Tria Hotel means excelence in all respects”
Reviews.Author: saccovanzetti
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Tria Hotel, Istanbul, for six nights in September 2009. We reserved a standard double room from the hotelâ€™s website. This was our first trip to Istanbul, and the free transport from and to the airport was greatly appreciated. Management and staff were very friendly, always ready to help. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, Serdar, the manager, helped us organize our daily tours to the tens of places we had listed to visit. Smiling Recep and Murat at the front office were always available for assistance and suggestions (and helped me improve my Turkish, too!) Tria is a small hotel of twenty rooms, very conveniently situated in the Sultanahmet quarter, close to the Historic treasures of Byzantine Constantinople and Ottoman Istanbul. CafÃ©s and restaurants are a minuteâ€™s walk away. It is spotlessly clean with beautiful views from the terrace. Our room was specious and quiet with a comfortable king size bed and all the facilities (there was even a kettle with instant coffee and tea for free hot drinks!). The breakfast was one of (I could say the) richest I ever had. There is a free internet at the lobby and we made good use of it. From the moment we checked in we felt at home and among friends. We wish to thank the people of Tria Hotel for making our stay in Istanbul one of our greatest experiences and hope to see them again. We whole-heartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Star staff and home away from home..”
Reviews.Author: Kingmisra
Reviews.Content: I must compliment the staff at Tria for making me feel at home from the moment I checked in..they were simply superb..also, the rooms have a nice homely touch and are very clean and comfortable. I will be back at Tria whenever I hit Istanbul. Cheers !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ISABELLA05
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean, nice bathroom with jacuzzi, staff very helpfull and friendly, nice breakfast, would love to stay there again! Sophia

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, spotless, moderately priced, smiling helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JeanBoston
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel from the website because it looked like a good location and decent hotel. It certainly was that and more. Great location- all things for tourists- within walking distance- great little markets all around for bottled water- snacks- beer, wine- decent restaurants and shops- Four Season's 1/2 block away for great food- the complimentary breakfast's were more than enough- the entire staff from houskeeping, to manager were helpful in everyway and welcoming. My 21 y/o daughter had her own room on 3rd floor and myself on 1st- am a very light sleeper and didn't hear ANYTHING all night. Large bathrooms- great water pressure- and extremely clean. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Few nice words about Tria Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexsaGP
Reviews.Content: Tria Hotel is defenetly nice for few nights staying. Everything was great - room, service, staff, location. No- crowded, no- stressed. Clean, quiet and comfortable enought. Nothing missed:) Recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Istanbul First Timers”
Reviews.Author: CPBAH
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the new rooms at Tria which had literally just opened. As you might expect the rooms were well finished, but they were to a quality you might expect from a far more expensive hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the location is second-to-none, just a short walk from the sighseeing treasures of Istanbul in Sultanahmet. It was a perfect base for our first time in Istanbul and we saw it all. It is also surrounded by some great restaurants and cafes and is a great place to come home to each day. Would highly recommend it - especially the newly refurbished rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to sights, but extremely noisy”
Reviews.Author: PupuceNewYork
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by location and room, linens/towels great, nice staff overall. Unpleasantly surprised to find out renovations were ongoing on the terrace, so disregard the terrace views pix on the website. Also shocked to wake up at 2 am in the middle of a construction site raucous that lasted over an hour...bulldozer-crane the size of the building had to come in the middle of the night to evacuate debris directly from the roof terrace. This was right outside our paper-thin windows: loud beeping, flashing lights and thunderous thuds... No one thought to inform us or offer different room. Weekdays are bearable noisewise, but week-ends are a late night cacophony of belly dancing/ club music from neighboring guesthouses and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A homey boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: joythetraveller
Reviews.Content: Located at the back street of the tourist area, Sultanahmet, it's a quite boutique hotel with walking distances to major sightseeing spots within the area. The rooms are comfy, and the washrooms are surprisingly clean and hygienic. if you are lucky enough, you would even be able to stay in the rooms with modern jacuzzi facility! Staff are friendly and helpful, especially the boy at the front desk, helped us proactively to contact the travel agent in arranging our transport to another city, even though we did not purchase the travel package from Tria. Would definitely want to go back to the hotel if travel again to Istanbul, as hard to find honest people and sincere services elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: FallbrookSallyB
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Tria hotel last weekend. The room was clean and staff friendly. We had problems with the air conditioner, which they fixed quickly. Breakfast was ample, but directed toward the European taste, understandable as Europeans constitute the largest percentage of their clients. Their computer is located in breakfast room, so is unavailable during those hours. But didn't matter, as the Internet connection almost never worked during our stay. Quite an inconvenience since closest Internet Cafe was 10 minute walk away or more. This hotel is not in the best location. It is on the edge of the Sulthanamet district, and requires a short walk to the tram line or sights. But it is quiet and room was pleasant. We did find that the staff tried to turn any question we had about Istanbul into an opportunity to sell a tour (no doubt they get a good commission). We enjoyed our stay at the Tria, but would choose another hotel for a return visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “relax in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: arzunia
Reviews.Content: very nice place to stay, staff's hospitality were great. a clean place to stay in the middle of old Istanbul, so close to all attractions. the breakfast is a most!!! we booked online, communicate through emails, and I made them crazy because my flight changed so many times, but they were so nice to cooperate. i would go back there if i want to go to Istanbul no boubt!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DodusSanDiego
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. It's small with a rooftop view of the harbor. The location is great in that we walked to all main attractions (Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar) The hotel staff were very helpful but their English was limited when we were trying to get directions to a destination by ferry. Also, our ATM card didn't work in Turkey and bank employees couldn't help due to limited English. We also had trouble with our taxi from the airport in that we were told it would cost 30 Euro and the driver (who spoke no English) wanted 60 Euro when we got to the hotel, gesturing that it cost more for the luggage!! We had the hotel front desk person handle the taxi driver. I would recommend arranging for airport transfers in advance. The hotel arranged for an English speaking guide for us for a day and he was great. Walking near the hotel is difficult in that the streets are cobblestone and the sidewalks are full of tables for the restaurants. We were there 6 days and all of the restauants near the hotel where we ate were excellent. It was truly an adventure!!

Reviews.Title: “overbooked”
Reviews.Author: marvellousworld
Reviews.Content: Room was booked by an online-booking site and confirmed. Upon arrival I was told there are no availabilites left because a) the travel agency made a mistake and b) to reserve two day in advance is too short notice (although they were aware of my reservation). Hotel did not honor reservation but offered their partner hotel (Adora) which is a 5-minutes drive. Hotel is okay with excellent location too, clean and quiet but does not have the athmosphere and roof top as the Tria. Reading other reviews it seems common that the overbook and move guests out who pay a lower rate. In order to avoid discussions and loss of time I would recommend not to book the hotel unless you pay rack rate and have contacted the hotel prior to arrival to doublecheck the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great view but watch your stuff”
Reviews.Author: tapkalama
Reviews.Content: Very convenient hotel in Sultanahmet. Not too noisy. Rooms are very clean, the ones on the front give a better view. Breakfast very good, great selection. View from the hotel rooftop is awesome of The Bosphorus, Blue Mosque and Ayasofia. Unfortunately have to give it OK, as had Â£20 stolen from inside a book in locked room. So, I should know better but, just made me feel abit uneasy that someone goes through your stuff...

Reviews.Title: “great location & hospitable staff!”
Reviews.Author: Hamadako
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for 7 days and decided to extend another 2 days because we enjoy the hotel location and its kind staffs. The hotel is a walking distance to a 3 "must visit" places in Istanbul. The hotel staffs, in particular the reception, were very hospitable and speak fluent English. The room, however, is a little bit small but clean, neat and provide kettle with selection of teas. Few nice night cafes and resto around the hotel. Its value for money, especially if you stay for few days, you will get pick up from/to airport, welcome fruits and wine. Breakfast is ok but need more variation for long stay guest. Check out the top floor terrace, its breathtaking view of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Priceless gem! Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: globalnomad79
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Tria for two nights after spending a night in a nearby hostel (our flight got in really late) and what a gem of a place it turned out to be. We absolutely loved the location - it's on a hidden side street close to a bakery and was within walking distance of the Haghia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque. In terms of location, it was pretty hard to beat - you definitely want to stay in Sultanamet cause the heat gets too much over at Taksim and we definitely looked forward to returning nightly to our haven. The rooms were absolutely gorgeous. Views were non-existent as we had the wall of another building but that wasn't a big deal for us. The interior of the room was excellent! Bathroom was immaculate. It just felt so polished and yet homey at the same time. The rooftop terrace was truly the icing on the cake. Breathtaking views, super comfy sofas and chairs - they even had a romantic swing up there! The best thing was the staff - friendly, accommodating and very gracious. We heard that there might have been a change in management recently. Still, I would definitely stay here again in the future whenever I am in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a scam”
Reviews.Author: shine70
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via a reputable hotel booking website two weeks before my stay. When I arrived at the hotel after a 13 hours flight I was told that no rooms were available. It seems that some customer decided to extend his stay so no place for me and my wife. The staff at the reception told us that we would be sent to another hotel, for the same price. However, while waiting for the car to the other hotel, a couple arrived into the hall and told us that it happened the same to them the day before. The hoter hotel apparently is in the middle of nowhere and a sort of a wreck, and suggested not to go at any cost, especially at the same price of the Tria. The reception staff agreed to cancel our booking, but we were left without hotel on a peak weekend. Please beware, you are not garanteed any stay at Tria even with a confirmed booking. Unless you accept the other hotel for the same price.

HotelInfo.Name: Tria Hotel Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Akbiyik Cad, Terbiyik Sok, no.7 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34100, Turkey
